ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do you think, if We let them enjoy themselves for years
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Did you consider that if We were to let them enjoy life for many years
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do you not see that even if We give them respite for years
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore observe, that if We give them some comforts for some years, –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Think, if We do let them enjoy for years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you then considered if We let them enjoy themselves for years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What thinkest thou? If We give them enjoyment of days for many years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hast thou then seen, if We content them for (long) years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Think! If We let them enjoy life for some years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Beholdest thou? - if We let them enjoy for years.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Tell me, should We let them enjoy for some years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Tell Me, if We do let them enjoy for years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What do you see? If We gave them enjoyment for years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have you considered: if We let them enjoy themselves for some years.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:205] Consider [this] then — inform Me: If We were to let them enjoy [life] for [many] years,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hast thou then seen) O Muhammad, (We content them for (long) years) in their state of disbelief,
